GENERAL.FURTHERINFORMATION: The ~o~aircraft~w~ will stay in a ~y~holding pattern~w~ for a few minutes before it ~y~attempts to land~w~.
GENERAL.NOTIFICATION: An aircraft is performing an ~r~emergency landing~w~ at ~y~{0}~w~. Head to the designated landing area and await further instructions.
The ~o~aircraft~w~ is now authorised to attempt an ~r~emergency landing~w~.
Scene is Code 4 as ~g~aircraft landed safely~w~ at ~y~{0}~w~.
Speak with the ~y~pilot~w~ and investigate the situation.
The aircraft has landed. ~y~Speak with pilot~w~ to verify everything is okay.
We were ~r~unable to spawn the aircraft~w~. Please try the callout again or contact support.
We've ~y~lost contact~w~ with the ~o~aircraft~w~ radar positioning. Attempt to establish a ~y~visual~w~ on the ~o~aircraft~w~.
We've ~g~regained contact~w~ with the ~o~aircraft~w~ radar positioning.
The ~o~aircraft~w~ has ~r~crashed~w~. Please wait while we route you to the crash site. Once located, continue as you see fit.

OUTCOME0.FURTHERINFORMATION: An ~o~aircraft~w~ is experiencing ~y~engine problems~w~. Head to the landing area & prepare for the aircraft's landing.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~y~Pilot:~w~ Thank you Officer! How did you like the landing?
~b~You:~w~ Not bad for someone with a smoking engine!
~y~Pilot:~w~ Well I appreciate you coming to make sure everything was okay. Do you need anything?
~b~You:~w~ Not at all, we just wanted to be there in case anything went wrong.
~y~Pilot:~w~ I'll have to get my mechanic to take a look at the engine. Had I been up in the air for a few more minutes I don't know if I'd be able to get it on the ground safely.
~b~You:~w~ You did a good job today. I'll let you take care of your plane, stay safe.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Thanks Officer. Take care and sorry for the inconvenience!

OUTCOME1.FURTHERINFORMATION: A passenger has ~r~died~w~ onboard an ~o~aircraft~w~. Speak with the pilot to establish if the circumstances are ~y~suspicious~w~.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hey Captain. Can you tell me what happened in the air?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Of course...I was taking my friend for a flight & they just passed out mid air.
~b~You:~w~ What do you mean exactly?
~y~Pilot:~w~ I was focusing on flying because the airspace was busy today, and I turn around and they weren't responsive. I then did an emergency landing here.
~b~You:~w~ Does your friend have any health conditions that they told you about?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Honestly, we never talked about it. I just assumed they'd be healthy enough to fly...
~b~You:~w~ This is a crime scene now so I'll need to investigate. Is that okay?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Yes of course Officer, you have my full cooperation.

OUTCOME2.NOTIFICATION: The ~o~aircraft~w~ is at risk of ~y~exploding anytime~w~. Speak with the pilot & proceed to evacuate!
The ~o~aircraft~w~ has ~r~exploded~w~. Continue as you see fit.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Get out of the plane and follow me! Quickly!

OUTCOME3.FURTHERINFORMATION: An ~o~aircraft~w~ is experiencing ~y~engine problems~w~ and needs to make an emergency landing. ~n~Reports are that the ~r~runway is blocked~w~. Clear it before the aircraft lands!
OUTCOME3.NOTIFICATION: Move the vehicle before the ~o~aircraft~w~ attempts to land then speak with the pilot~w~.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~y~Pilot:~w~ That was a close call. Thanks for clearing the runway in time.
~b~You:~w~ No problem at all. Just glad we could get that vehicle out of your way. How's the plane holding up?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Could've been worse, engine trouble hit us hard. Managed to get down safely though.
~b~You:~w~ You did a heck of a job given the circumstances.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Thanks, it is all part of the job I suppose.
~b~You:~w~ Definitely. We're just glad you're safe. Do you need any assistance?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Nah, we'll manage. We've got the ground crew en route.
~b~You:~w~ Alright then. If you need anything, give us a shout.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Will do, thanks again for your help, Officer.

OUTCOME4.FURTHERINFORMATION: An ~o~aircraft~w~ is reporting an emergency due to a ~y~suspected stowaway~w~ onboard. Apprehend the aircraft upon landing.
OUTCOME4.NOTIFICATION: Checking to see if ~y~any prisoners have escaped~w~ in the last 24 hours. Standby.
We can confirm a ~y~{0}~w~ escaped from prison in the last 24 hours. Suspect is still at large.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hey there, how can we help?
~y~Pilot:~w~ While I was flying I heard some shuffling in my aircraft. And it sounded like an animal.
~b~You:~w~ Have you left your aircraft unattended recently?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Yes, I don't have a hanger so I left it out for a few days.
~b~You:~w~ What do you think it might be?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Well Officer, I have my suspicions that I have a stowaway onboard. I didn't want to check, but if you can search my plane I'd appreciate it.
~b~You:~w~ Let me just check something with Dispatch.
~b~You:~w~ I'm going to search your aircraft now.
~b~You:~w~ Don't move! What do you think you're doing here?
~r~Stowaway:~w~ Oh, uh...I was just trying to get somewhere. Look, you've got the wrong person.
~b~You:~w~ Save it, you're not as sneaky as you think. We know who you are.
~r~Stowaway:~w~ I swear Officer, I didn't mean any harm. I just needed a way out.
~b~You:~w~ A way out? Well you've certainly found one. Running around with a warrant on your head is a way back to the cells.
~r~Stowaway:~w~ Please, you gotta understand. It's complicated.
~b~You:~w~ Complicated doesn't excuse breaking the law. You're coming with me.

OUTCOME5.FURTHERINFORMATION: An ~o~aircraft~w~ is reporting an emergency due to a ~y~smashed window~w~ that occured during flight. Head to the landing area and prepare for the aircraft's landing.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~y~Pilot:~w~ Officer, thanks for being here. That was one heck of a landing.
~b~You:~w~ No problem, Captain. We got the call about your window. Are you alright?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Yeh, just a bit shaken. Never had a window shatter like that mid-flight.
~b~You:~w~ You handled it well, though. How did you manage to stay calm?
~y~Pilot:~w~ Years of training, I guess. It was all about keeping focus and getting us down safely.
~b~You:~w~ Well you certainly did a great job. We had emergency services on standby just in case. Glad we didn't need them.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Me too. Thanks for your help, I appreciate it.
~b~You:~w~ Anytime, Captain. That's what we are here for. Take care, let us know if you need anything else.

OUTCOME6.FURTHERINFORMATION: An ~o~aircraft~w~ is making an emergency landing due to ~y~bad weather conditions~w~. Head to the landing area and prepare for the aircraft's landing.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~y~Pilot:~w~ Whew, that was quite a landing.
~b~You:~w~ Are you alright Captain? That storm came out of nowhere.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Yeah. The weather radar didn't do justice to the turbulence out there.
~b~You:~w~ You did a remarkable job bringing her down safely. We were worried about you.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Thanks Officer. I appreciate you being here to ensure everything went smoothly. It was touch and go for a moment.
~b~You:~w~ Glad you're safe. Let me know if you need assistance with anything.
~y~Pilot:~w~ Thanks again. I'll talk to ATC once we're ready to move. Hopefully the weather lets up soon.
~b~You:~w~ Fingers crossed. Take care Captain and good job again.
